# Getting started with GitHub (2025-11-08 10:21-0800)

_**User (2025-11-06 15:12-0800)**_

What do I need to push this entire project to Github? I have nothing created, begin from basics

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Outlining GitHub push procedure**</details></think>

---

### Push Project to GitHub

- **Prep machine**: Confirm `git --version` works; install Xcode CLT if it fails. Ensure you can authenticate to GitHub (SSH key `ssh -T git@github.com` or PAT for HTTPS).  
- **Inspect project**: In `/Users/pankaj/projects/vira`, run `git status` to confirm it isn’t already a repo. Review for secrets or generated assets you must not publish.  
- **Init repo**:  
  - `git init`  
  - Create `.gitignore` suited to the stack (`python`, `node`, `macOS`, build artifacts). Double-check large binary dirs (e.g. `node_modules`, `venv`, datasets) stay ignored.  
- **Stage baseline**:  
  - `git add .` (or stage selectively if needed)  
  - `git status` to review  
  - `git commit -m "Initial commit"`  
- **Create remote**: On GitHub UI → New repository (`vira`, public/private). Skip adding README/.gitignore there since the local repo already has them.  
- **Connect remote**:  
  - `git remote add origin git@github.com:<user>/vira.git` (SSH) or HTTPS equivalent.  
  - If switching remote later, run `git remote set-url origin …`.  
- **Push**:  
  - `git branch -M main` (if main preferred)  
  - `git push -u origin main`  
- **Verify**: Refresh GitHub repo page; confirm files and commit show up.  
- **Next steps**: Set up branch protection, CI, or additional remotes once initial push succeeds.

Call out any blockers (missing git, auth errors, large files) before pushing.
